data.title: Barnett Family Crest, Coat of Arms and Name History
data.meta_description: Barnett Coat of Arms and Barnett Family Crest. Learn about the history of this surname and heraldry from our database and online image library.
data.text:
Meaning, Origin, Etymology

This name is of Anglo-Norman descending across Ireland, Scotland and Wales in early times and can be found in many manuscripts in the mediaeval period in these countries. Barnett can be found in English, French, Dutch, Polish, Czech, and Slovenian cultures. It derives from a Germanic personal name of Bernhard which is made up of the elements ber(n) ‘bear’ + hard ‘brave’, ‘hardy’, ‘strong’. Barnett is either a topographical or habitational name. Topographical it means one who lived on “land cleared by burning”. Habitational comes from many place names such as Friern Barnet in Greater London, East Barnet or Chipping (High) Barnet. It may also be a variant of the personal name of ‘Bernard’ or ‘Bernhard’ meaning ‘brave-bear’. It is also a baptismal name that was brought to England by the Normans around 1066 and immediately following the conquest it became a very popular forename and surname due greatly to the virtue of being borne by Saint Bernard of Clairvaux, 1090-1153, founder and Abbot of the Cistercian Monastery at Clairvaux. Olde English forms of this surname are: bærnet meaning ‘place cleared by burning’ and bærnan meaning ‘to burn’ or ‘to set light to’. The first person to be recorded with the spelling of Barnett is Jane Barnett, dated January 29, 1656 with her marriage to James Davison, County Derry, Ulster, Ireland, during the period of the Commonwealth (1649-1659).

Spelling Variations

Barnett, Barnette, Barnet, Barnet, Bernard, Barnard, Bernard, Bernadine, Barnett, Barnatt, Burnet, and Burnett.

Popularity & Geographic Distribution

The last name Barnett ranks 3,124th in popularity worldwide as of the 2014 Census and approximately 181,584 people carry the Barnett surname worldwide. The name ranks particularly high in the following six states: Texas, California, Georgia, Ohio, Florida, and Tennessee. It ranks highest in the following countries: United States (124,844), England (26,274), Australia (8,853), Jamaica (4,316), Canada (4,216), New Zealand (2,704)

Early Bearers of Surname

John Barnett of Macroom, on May 4th 1773

Denis Barnett of Rosscarbery, on November 6th 1864

Cornelius Barnett, and his wife the former Ellen Hurly, who were witnesses at the christening of their son, John, at Skibbereen, County Cork, on May 2nd 1866

Brictnod de la Bernet in Sussex, circa 1200

John Barnet, Bishop of Worcester and Treasurer of All England, who died in 1373

Steven Barnatt of Templemore, Derry, christened on May 20th 1660

St. Bernard of Menthon (923–1008), founder of Alpine hospices and patron saint of mountaineers

Doctor Thomas Barnardo, 1845-1905, founded the orphanages that still bear his name in Ireland

John Bernardes Corea 1778 of Scotland

Abel Bernarde, County Oxfordshire, who was registered in the University of Oxford in the year 1581

William filius Bernardi who was recorded in the ‘Hundred Rolls’, England, in the year 1273

History, Genealogy & Ancestry

BARNETT OF STRATTON PARK.

Barnett, Charles, Esq. of Stratton Park, County Bedford, b. 31 Oct 1796; married 1 Feb 1826, Elizabeth, 3rd daughter of Sir Peter Payne, Bart., and has issue, 1) Charles-Fitzroy Capt. 54th b. 12 Oct. 1830 2) George-James b. 8 Dec 1831 3) Clayton b. 15 Sept. 1839 4) Rosewell b. 3 May 1841 5) Harriet Anna Maria Stanhope 6) Elizabeth 7) Laura Janet Emma married to James Chadwick Esq. 8) Louisa-Marie married to Frederick Dawkins, Esq. of Moggerhanger Park, Bedfordshire. Mr. Barnett was high sheriff of the County of Bedford in 1821.

Lineage ~ Curtis Barnett Esq., son of Lieut. Barnett, who was lost in the ‘Stirling Castle’ man-of-war, in 1703, married 13 May 1725, Elizabeth daughter of Benjamin Rosewell, Esq., and died 29 April 1746, at Fort St. David’s in the East Indies, being commander-in-chief of his majesty’s ships designed on a particular service, leaving a son, Charles Barnett Esq., of Stratton Park, County Bedford, who married 17 Feb 1756, Bridget , 3rd daughter of Alexander Clayton, Esq., and had (with other children deceased), Charles his heir; James, banker, of Lombard Street; and Bridget. The eldest son and heir, Major-Gen. Charles Barnett of Stratton Park b. in March 1758 married 22 Feb 1796, Harriet, eldest daughter of Admiral Sir Richard King, Bart., by whom, who died 17 Sept. 1799. He had a daughter Caroline, wife of J. McGrath, MD and an only son and successor, the present Charles Barnett, Esq. of Stratton Park. Gen. Barnett died 10 Oct 1804 at Gibraltar, of which garrison he was then around in command.

BARNETT OF GLYMPTON

Barnett, Henry, Esq., of Glympton Park, County Oxford, J.P. and D.L., formerly M.P. for Woodstock, and Lieut-Col. Oxfordshire Yeomanry Cavalry, succeeded his father 1871; married 1838 Emily-Anne, daughter of John Stratton, Esq., of Chesterton, and had (with two younger sons and four daughters) George-Wheate.

Lineage ~ George-Henry Barnett, Esq. of Glympton Park, County Oxford J.P. and D.L. (eldest son of Benjamin Barnett, Esq. of London, Banker, by Anne his wife, daughter and eventual heiress of Sir George Wheate, Bart of Glympton Park), married 1865, Elizabeth Canning, sister of Viscount Stratford de Redeliffe, and had with other issue, 1) Henry now of Glympton 2) Charles-George of Sunningdale, Berks J.P., Banker in London b. 1818; married 22 April 1847, Marianne-Jane daughter of Edward St. John Mildmay, Esq. 6th son of Sir Henry P. Mildmay, Bart., and has issue, Charles Edward m. the Hon. Augusta Rose Benn Walsh; three sons, and two daughters. George Henry Barnett died in 1871. The family held seats in Glympton Park and Woodstock.

John Barnett who settled in Virginia in 1620

Nich Barnett, who landed in Virginia in 1635

Mottoes

Nisi paret imperat Unless he obeys he commands

Finis Coronat Opus The End Crowns The Work

Grantees

BARNETT, John Morris, of the Borough of Blackpool, MBE, DL (Lancashire). Arms and Crest. Garter and Norroy and Ulster Kings of Arms. 4/6/2013. College reference: Grants 177/196.

THOMAS BARNETT, Lord of the Manor of Kempstone, is the second son of John Edward Barnett. Livery — Blue. Armorial bearings, as in rough sketch supplied, are for AlVOS: . . . a chevron, and in chief two ronndles ; and for the Crest, out of a coronet a [f s;rij}in’ s) head ; with the Motto, ” Paret insi imperat.” The arms and crest an of no authority. Married, May 28, 1850, Sarah, daug of Stephen Leeds ; and has Issue — (i) Arthur Thomas Barnett , born September 21, 1858; (2) Erancis Thomas Barnett, born March 6, 1861 ; (3) Harold Thomas Barnett, born January 6, 1865 ; (4) Bertram Leeds Thomas Barnett, born June 22, 1875; Ellen; Edith Ann ; Julia Marian; Katherinc Sarah ; and Mabel. Estate and postal address — Nyton, Aldingbournc, Chichester.
